ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.

The indicator is relevant because it reflects the health situation in Burundi.
Updating the indicator requires exhaustive collection in health facilities. For most of the data, data from private health facilities are not taken into account.

Goal 1. Eradicate poverty in all its forms and everywhere

Burundi Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies (ISTEEBU)

It is the total compensation of employees and social transfers made, expressed as a percentage of GDP, that is a measure of total output for a given reference period.
Percentage
Household surveys or administrative data
Data are collected by carrying out ECVMB type surveys / daily data from national accounts
ISTEEBU
ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling the data allowing the calculation of this indicator at the national level
ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination, after validation, of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making

The indicator provides information on the relative share of production that is paid as compensation to employees compared to the share paid to capital in the production process for a given reference period

The share of labor in GDP calculated solely on the basis of compensation of employees underestimates the proportion of accumulated GDP in relation to total employment, because it does not include the labor income of the self-employed.
Total compensation of employees in relation to gross domestic product, expressed as a percentage
Survey data is validated at two levels: internal validation and extended validation
The indicator is available at national level
ISTEEBU, Survey on the living conditions of Burundian households (ECVMB) 2013-2014, National accounts of 2014

NDAYISENGA Modest

ESSSP department manager
1156 BUJUMBURA
ndayimode2010@gmail.com;

The total fertility rate measures the number of children a woman would have, during her fertile life, if she behaved in accordance with the fertility-by-age observed in a given year. It is obtained by adding the average number of births per woman in all the years defined as fertile (from 15 to 49 years)
Number
Household surveys
Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
The probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)
ISTEEBU
ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.

The total fertility rate is relevant because it measures the number of children a woman would have, during her fertile life, if she behaved in accordance with the fertility by age observed in a given year. It is obtained by adding the average number of births per woman in all the years defined as fertile (from 15 to 49 years)
Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive. The indicator cannot be calculated by gender.
It is obtained by adding the average number of births per woman in all the years defined as fertile (from 15 to 49 years)
The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
The indicator is available at national level, province, area of residence (National; Urban area; Rural area)
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level

Goal 16. Promote the emergence of peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, ensure access to justice for all and build, at all levels, effective, accountable and inclusive institutions
16.6 Build effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels
16.6.5. Index-Mo Ibrahim on Governance
Ministry of Good Governance
BIGIRIMANA Dieudonne
Statistical service
SDG focal point within the Ministry
dieudonneb11@yahoo.fr

The Ibrahim Index of Governance in Africa (IIAG) is a tool for measuring and monitoring governance performance in African countries. The Mo Ibrahim Foundation defines governance as access to goods and public services, in the political, social and economic fields to which each citizen can legitimately claim from his state and which every state is required to offer to its fellow citizens. Within the framework of the IIAG, a country's governance performance is measured using four components: Security and Rule of Law, Participation and Human Rights, Sustainable economic development and human development.

Goal 2. End hunger, achieve food security, improve nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture

2.2 By 2030, end all forms of malnutrition, including achieving by 2025 internationally agreed targets for stunting and wasting in children under 5 years, and meet the nutritional needs of adolescent girls, pregnant or breastfeeding women and the elderly
2.2.1. Number of underweight children under 5 (Acute malnutrition)
ISTEEBU
NDAYISENGA Modest
Department of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODD
Head of Service and Focal Point
ndayimode2010@gmail.com

Acute malnutrition is a form of undernutrition. It is caused by a decrease in food intake and / or associated disease causing bilateral edema and / or sudden weight loss. Its severe form is characterized by the presence of bilateral edema or emaciation (low weight-for-height z-score or low MUAC). We distinguish the Global Acute Malnutrition (MAG) which is the sum of Moderate Acute Malnutrition (MAM) and Severe Acute Malnutrition (SAM).
Nutritional surveys

Updating the indicator requires a household survey which requires a lot of resources and most of which is donated by partners
It is defined as a weight-for-height (PTZ) z-score less than two standard deviations of the median of the reference population.
The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
The indicator is available at national level, province, Place of residence (Total; Girls; Boys; 6-11 months; 12-23 months; 24-59 months)

Official development assistance (ODA) is defined as the flows of public finance administered with the promotion of economic development and the well-being of developing countries as the main objective, and which are concessional in nature with a subsidy element of at least 25% (using a fixed 10 percent discount rate). By convention, ODA flows include contributions from donor government agencies, at all levels, to developing countries (bilateral ODA) and multilateral institutions.

LIndice Ibrahim de la gouvernance en Afrique (IIAG) est un outil de mesure et de suivi des performances en matire de gouvernance dans les pays africains. La Fondation Mo Ibrahim dfinit la gouvernance comme laccs des biens et des services publics, dans les domaines politique, social et conomique auxquels chaque citoyen peut lgitimement prtendre auprs de son tat et que tout tat est tenu doffrir ses concitoyens Dans le cadre de lIIAG, les performances dun pays en matire de gouvernance sont mesures partir de quatre composantes: : Scurit et tat de droit, Participation et Droits humains, Dveloppement conomique durable et Dveloppement humain.

La malnutrition aigu est une forme de sous-nutrition. Elle est cause par une baisse dans la consommation de nourriture et/ou une maladie associes causant des dmes bilatraux et/ou une perte de poids soudaine. Sa forme svre est caractrise par la prsence doedmes bilatraux ou de lmaciation (faible z-score de poids-pour-taille ou faible primtre brachial). On y distingue la Malnutrition Aige Globale (MAG) qui est la somme de la Malnutrition Aige Modre (MAM) et de la Malnutrition Aige Svre (MAS).

Laide publique au dveloppement (APD) est dfinie comme les flux de financement public administrs avec la promotion du dveloppement conomique et du bien-tre des pays en dveloppement comme objectif principal, et qui ont un caractre concessionnel avec un lment de subvention dau moins 25% (en utilisant un taux fixe de remise de 10 pour cent). Par convention, les flux dAPD comprennent les contributions des organismes gouvernementaux donateurs, tous les niveaux, aux pays en dveloppement (APD bilatrale) et aux institutions multilatrales.

Objectif 9. Btir une infrastructure rsiliente, promouvoir une industrialisation durable qui profite tous et encourager linnovation

9.3 Accrotre, en particulier dans les pays en dveloppement, laccs des entreprises, notamment des petites entreprises industrielles, aux services financiers, y compris aux prts consentis des conditions abordables, et leur intgration aux chanes de valeur et aux marchs
9.3.1 Proportion des petites entreprises dans la valeur ajoute totale de lindustrie

La proportion des petites entreprises dans la valeur ajoute totale de l'industrie reprsente la part de la valeur ajoute manufacturire des petites entreprises manufacturires dans la valeur ajoute manufacturire totale. Une entreprise est la plus petite unit lgale qui constitue une unit organisationnelle produisant des biens ou des services. Les entreprises industrielles sont classes de petites par rapport aux grandes ou moyennes pour leur nature distincte d'organisation conomique, de capacit de production, d'chelle d'investissement et d'autres caractristiques conomiques
